Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the photograph was taken without a telescope when it was actually a composite of two separate images.
Understate: The claim understates the size of the Andromeda Galaxy, stating that it appears almost identical to a garden-variety star, when in reality it spans 260,000 light-years across.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up the claim that the photograph was taken without a telescope.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photograph accurately represents the size of the Andromeda Galaxy next to the moon, without considering that it is a composite image.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the photograph is a composite of two separate images, which could affect the accuracy of the size comparison.
